history.content:
Good morning,

Please find the announcements for this week below. You might also be interested in signing up for this month's faculty/student lunch, happening on 11/14 12-1pm. Thank you to IEEE and CSUA for coordinating these events. 

Best wishes,

Nicole

1. EECS Grad School Application Workshop

2. Shadow an Engineer Week

3. LeaderShape application extended

4 .Prizes and Honors Program 2017-18

5. MIT Business & Analytics Happy Hour

6. The Big Ideas Contest Launches for UC Berkeley!

7. Evidence in Governance and Politics network on campus​ seeks Web Assistant Work-Study

8. Seniors, sign up for your senior portraits.

1. EECS Grad School Application Workshop

There will be a mentorship workshop on Thursday, November 9th from 5-7pm in Cory 540, co-sponsored by WICSE and AWE, during which graduate students can offer you editing help and advice on your application. Specifically, you should prepare:

- a draft of your personal statement and all other relevant essays

- a draft of your resume

 

The event will be relatively informal, where you will be able to talk to a graduate student one-on-one about your application. Here is the Facebook event link.

2. Shadow an Engineer Winter 2017

Student application due November 6, 11:59pm

Curious what it's like to be an engineer in industry? Apply for Shadow an Engineer Program hosted by Society of Women Engineers!

 

Through this program, you will have the opportunity to get real-life exposure at some of the most innovative companies in the area! This program will occur for 1 to 3 days over winter break and is an awesome chance to network with the company you might want to work for in the future.

 

Apply here: http://tinyurl.com/saefall17student

Program descriptions: http://tinyurl.com/ybt39wut

Facebook event link: https://www.facebook.com/events/127759791278569/

 

*All genders are encouraged to apply

*You will be responsible for your own transportation to the company location, we do not provide travel reimbursement

 

3. LeaderShape Application Extended

The LeaderShape Institute Deadline has been extended to this Friday, November 3, 11:59pm
What: The LeaderShape Institute is a six-day leadership training retreat.

When: The week before the spring semester, January 7-12, 2018.

Cost: None, paid for by our sponsors: Boeing, General Motors, College of Chemistry and the Berkeley Engineering Annual Fund.

Who can apply: Any second, third or fourth-year undergraduate student who is either in the College of Engineering, chemical engineering major or an active member of an engineering student organization is welcome to apply.

More Details: Sessions include such exercises as team-building, a ropes course, charting visions for a brighter future and exploring ethical issues. Panel discussions feature business and community leaders. If you’re looking to make a global impact with groundbreaking innovations, this is an excellent place to start.

Apply here

 

4 .Prizes and Honors Program 2017-18

The Prizes Program at UC Berkeley is an important forum for rewarding creative expression and scholarly achievement by Berkeley's finest students. Winners receive both recognition and a cash prize, which is coordinated with the winner's financial aid package, if any. Copies of the essays and poetry submissions chosen to receive prizes are archived at the Bancroft Library at the end of each year. Deadlines for most contests are from December through March. More info here

 

5. MIT Business & Analytics Happy Hour

Thursday, November 2 | 5:00-6:00pm Cafe Blue Door 2244 Bancroft Way

Join the Director of the Master of Data Science and Business Analytics program for an information session to learn about the newest and most competitive graduate degree program at MIT. Founded by Professor Dimitris Bertsimas, the MIT Business Analytics program is tailored for highly quantitative students interested in pursuing graduate education and careers in data science and analytics.  RSVP here.


6. The Big Ideas Contest Launches for UC Berkeley!
Big Ideas is an early-stage university-based innovation contest that connects students with the mentorship, training, and resources needed to successfully conceptualize, deploy, and scale social innovations. Open to undergraduate and graduate students with creative solutions that address social challenges, the contest awards up to $300,000 in prizes across 40-50 winning teams annually. Since its founding in 2006, the competition has inspired over 1,400 student-led projects aimed at solving the world's most pressing problems.

Learn more at our information session! Wednesday, Oct 18 | 6:00pm | B100 Blum Hall
Check out our full list of events here!

 

7. Evidence in Governance and Politics network on campus​ seeks Web Assistant Work-Study

Job Description: EGAP is seeking web and administrative support for tasks including but not limited to: Maintaining and updating the EGAP website using Drupal 7; preparing entertainment and reimbursement/other payment requests using UC Berkeley's Travel and Entertainment System; creating and updating spreadsheets for tracking financial information; event support; and help with general office duties as needed. Prior office work experience preferred but will train motivated candidate. The position will be approximately 10 hours per week, with flexible days and times. This position is ideal for a freshmen or sophomore seeking a position on campus for at least 3 or more semesters. Please email your resume and a brief letter to Goldie Negelev at GNegelev1@berkeley.edu indicating why you are interested and qualified for the position. Please include whether you are able to bring a personal laptop.

 

Qualifications: Knowledge of Drupal 7/8, as well as other related areas of IT hosting; Can create clear, easy-to-navigate, informative, accurate, well-designed, and functional websites; Knowledge of web development with HTML5 and CSS3;Comfortable using Microsoft Word and Excel; Comfortable in Mac or PC environment; The applicant should be able to follow directions, work independently and as part of a team, able to learn quickly, have strong organization skills, meet deadlines and have strong problem-solving skills.

 

8. Reminder to all Seniors! Make sure you sign up for Senior Portraits so you can be in the Official 2017-2018 UC Berkeley Yearbook. You can sign up here: https://laurenorders.com/login by creating an account with the school password GoBears.
